artist: Artist: Ellsworth Kelly; Publisher: Maeght Éditeur, Paris
creditline: Gift of Carolyn and Bob Nelson
description: large orange shape, rather like the letter "B", on white ground
portfolio: From Suite of Twenty-Seven Color Lithographs (1965)
provenance: Bob and Carolyn Nelson, Wayzata, Minn.; given to MIA, 2007.
signed: LLC, in pencil: [75/75]; LRC, in pencil: [Kelly]
text: Ellsworth Kelly distills the observed and experienced world into abstracted forms or fragments. He articulates these reductive geometric forms in sculpture, paintings, and prints, by emphasizing their physical and material qualities--size, shape, color, mass, edges, and surface texture. The result, as seen in this monochromatic lithograph, is elegant in its stark simplicity and conceptual refinement.
title: Red-Orange (Rouge-Orange)
